result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dezirae L Bruette

records.addlTxt: DENIED because the court finds the defendant qualifies for Public Defender representation.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
11:05 AM Defendant Dezirae L Bruette in court.  Prosecuting attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives reading of the complaint and her right to be represented by counsel. Rights explained.  Not guilty plea(s).  Jury calendar.
Further proceedings scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Further proceedings on October 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Order to Seal Probable Cause Statement.
The original document was titled: Probable cause statement /judicial determination
The original history event date is: 08-26-2022

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of battery and disorderly conduct.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 09-15-22 at 10:30 a.m. B-15.  Bail is set at $650.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that she have no contact with A.D.H., DOb: 12-09-2004 and no contact with the Manitowoc County Expo through midnight on 08-28-2022.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody. Court orders photos and prints at MTPD.
Minutes.
